column4: ok now second question about rar archives... is there an app that will open multi-part rar files?
apt-get install unrar
it's an option during the install, as long as you choose it, when you boot you should get the menu of which OS to book
i think once unrar is installed, you can also open the archive with the graphical archive manager and extract that way
bad advice
if you are at least running the nvidia driver, you can sudo apt-get install nvidia-settings and use that to customize your resolution, thats what I use
yeah I tried the nvidia-settings but its telling me Im not using an nvidia driver, so that one didnt work
this from the downloaded install from nvidia?
you should be in fairly good shape so far then
you're at a terminal?
you can try running sudo nvidia-xconfig from the terminal, then restarting x, or run sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg, and go through the menu to redo your xorg.conf
its asking if I want to use a kernel framebuffer device... yes or no?
any luck?
what about the restart of x after dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
what is? nvidia-settings?
you only do that once, i thought you already did it
each thing you 'try' may be putting you a bit further in the hole, say yes to the framebuffer
even after selecting nvidia in the dpkg-reconfigure?
You do not appear to be using the Nvidia X driver
ok, thats all i can really try, the only other thing i could think to look for is errors in /var/log/Xorg.0.log
that file is empty
its system->admin -> hardware
on the other hand, only one way to learn :)
